column6: text
Good sub, great fries, and exceptional service.  Not in the area often but will be sure to visit when I return.
Best corned beef sandwich in NE Ohio. The corned beef melt is so awesome! Homemade potato salad rocks, too!
The male cashier was so rude to the person in front of us and to me. Invest in customer service training for your store. Horrible experience. I won't be back.
Worst shopping experience ever. The staff in the store is so rude. Had to buy some insoles for my Scarpas but refused to buy anything else. Never going here again.

As an Ohian, I am used to the same clubs, same crowd and the same outcome. Fwd is a breath of fresh air here in N.E. Ohio. There's nothing like it anywhere around. The atmosphere was exciting, the people were great, and the bartenders were excellent. You have to see it to believe it. New favorite spot!

By far the worst company to get a hold of. I no longer live in Ohio and cannot get a hold of ANYONE to discuss my membership. 

If someone at this office can please be considerate enough to contact me back it would be greatly appreciated. 

This I ridiculous.

I love this coffee shop! Its super cute and vintage on the inside but it also has tables outside where you can sit and have your coffee and pastry. Super quiet so if you are looking for a place to study this is a go go. The cookies there are so big and super delicious! Also the hot chocolate is a must in the fall and winter time! Also the people there are really friendly which is a plus!

The best place ever. 
Clean. Friendly. Dare I say fun? 
Brand new. Great machines. 
My clothes never looked so good-almost new again. Cards easy to use. Will
Never go anywhere else!

Jay and izzy are the man. 
Love the art on the wall and the food is great. Wonderful place in Solon hosted by two of the best in the biz. The pizza is amazing. The salads are the bomb and the staff is friendly. Can't wait to go back.

I feel compelled to post this review after reading the review about running out of bread. We love district. We have been about 4 or 5 times and we LOVE LOVE LOVE the bread. We understand it is fresh and sometimes we ask for seconds!  It's a guilty pleasure. I also feel that posting reviews can be helpful for the restaurant and they should be perfect but who is perfect?  Let the restaurants fix the mistake while you are at the table. I haven't tried the meatballs but I love the calamari, lamb t- bone and the salmon. Bring the goose confit back!

Long wait 
Phone fixed
Not sure apple cares
I like product
Easy to use
Lots of people waiting
Typical Apple

Picked up some salads to go and they were fresh. The staff is incredible and the place is clean. I love the original and the cottage fries are Delish. The setting is cool and the people are nice. I wish jay was there more but I'll call his cell phone next time. Thanks for being there!

Food consistent 
Always fresh
Staff friendly
Love the price
Love the atmosphere
Like the cement

Went there for drinks 
Staff was very friendly
Love the juke box
Bathrooms clean
Great vibe
Love the place

very cool new place, downtown cleveland, playhouse square style.
great ambiance, amazing food, friendly service. cant wait to come back.

Love the food
Love Kenny
Love the jell rings 
The food is always amazing and the place is clean. The cashiers are friendly and the food is fresh. Can't wait to go back

What a great find!  We were shopping on Small Business Saturday at the Arcade Shops and found Chrissie's on the way out.  For those of you who like gourmet popcorn, this is somewhere you need to try.  We bought 4 flavors, all of which were very fresh and come packaged in resealable bags.  Prices are VERY reasonable for the quality and quantity you get.  The standout flavors to me were the Kettle Corn and the White Cheddar.   There are also several seasonal flavors that are creative.   A very friendly staff operates the very neat and clean space.   We will definitely be back!!

My father was at Heartland of Willoughby for Physical Therapy due to a Fall. Great service and employees! Each day I was visiting my father, the STNA's were friendly and supportive. Nurses were very compassionate and informative of my fathers med's. I would definitely bring another relative here for any service they offer.

I paid a lot of money for two windows that were supposed to be an exact replica of the two windows they were to replace!! I mean a lot! I was informed by a salesman that they would be just the same and please have no worries. He did not ever show me a sample but, I figured that was okay since they were very old and unique. He never took any photos that I know of also. He then assured me that the contract that I signed would be copied and sent to me. This never happened so I could not have known that the windows were not going to be replicas and upon discovering this I made numerous phone calls that were not returned until finally ED called me back and listened to my issues and then never returned my call again. I sent an email to corporate and they never called me or emailed me. I have more windows to replace but will never deal with these people again. Don't do it!!!!! If they tell you something you are assured it won't happen or it is a lie.
(They were bullies.They also made a big deal about me not wanting to have the work done in subzero weather. They assured me that any kind of weather is fine for the window replacement. They were all up in arms when I cancelled once due to horrible subzero weather! They then did the work in heavy snowy zero weather! and I am sorry I let them.) I am a single female.
column7: Pella Window & Door Showroom of Bedford Heights

column6: I was unhappy with my previous hair stylist and on the lookout for a new salon. I randomly came across Big Primpin on Facebook and decided to give them a try. I stopped by the salon on my way home from work to make an appointment and Nicolette was able to squeeze me in the next week before my trip. I showed her some pics of the color I wanted and how I wanted my hair and she did exactly what I wanted. I was so happy! Nicolette was friendly, funny and professional. The salon is clean and conveniently located. I was so pleased and will definitely be going back.  I highly recommend Big Primpin!

One of my favorite breakfast places in Lakewood/Cleveland! I always go for the breakfast tacos and a side of cheesy home fries. The pancakes are always delicious (chocolate chip are especially). One problem with this place is that there is almost ALWAYS a line to get in. The place is small and cozy and the line is usually out the door. But it is definitely worth the wait

If I was rating the food alone I would give Sartinis 5 stars. But they have major problems with their online ordering system. First they have two websites and two delivery systems. One is through beyond menu and the other through toast tab. The beyond menu online menu is not complete. You can't order everything such as making your own calzone. The toast tab menu is confusing and every time we've ordered the calzone we get a pizza delivered. Apparently the restaurant receives the order as a pizza. We've notified them of this problem and it hasn't been fixed. Today when we ordered we put a note in the special instructions to please make this a calzone! The delivery person said it was good that we wrote that because they were going to make us a pizza. They did however still screw up our order by giving us sausage instead of mushrooms. The only reason we're not super upset is that the pizza is really good. I really hope they fix their online ordering system because I'd like to continue to order from here!

EDIT: The restaurant reached out to me and assured me they will fix the issue. I'm confident they will and can't wait to order a calzone again from here!

This is a great place for brunch! Absolutely love the bloody mary bar! Our favorite menu items are the huevos rancheros, chicken and waffles, and the cheesy grits are a must! Excellent service and the staff are fantastic.

Nice place. We enjoy getting breakfast here each time we are in the area. They do not have any gluten free or gluten sensitive option other than salad. Prices are reasonable and the service is fast and friendly.

I just purchased a new set of tires for my SRX.  In and out in under an hour.  Mike at the desk couldn't have been more helpful, knowledgeable and attentive.  The staff was great, the tires are great and I am still in shock at what a great deal I received on the tires.  I compared prices online and they matched the price without me asking and none of the hassle.  I would highly recommend them for new tires.
The best Cassata cake anywhere!!! Good thing I live about an hour away if not I'll be so fat.
good burger !! I like B spot better but my girls like Flip Side better.
Don't know much about Thai food, but the food here is good . I try the green curry with chicken which was very good and alot better than Pai Thai in Hudson.
Saigon Grille is as good as Superior Pho in taste but their portions are smaller than Superior Pho. The restaurant itself is a lot nicer than Superior Pho.
Subs are ok. The service can be better. I like Alecsi better,
Ty fun have the best Pad Thai I ever have,and their curry is very good also. i thought Peppermint was good but Ty Fun Is better!
3.5 stars. My wife and my two girls love this place,but for me they over cook my beef. I think the female like this place better. when we came here it is like 3 female to 1 male.

For me this place is just OK. We have beef chow fun,wonton noodle soup ,roast duck and general Tso's chicken.
The wonton noodles soup was pretty good the best in Cleveland. But the chow fun is very greasy  and not much taste,the roast duck is dry and the same with the chicken. 
They use a lot of MSG there after I ate there I have to drink a lot of water.
Best coened beef sandwich in Cleveland.
Good attentive service, great food had the veal chop and short rib both were perfect. The reason for only 4-stars is little overprice!

Went to Otani for 1/2 price sushi, the sushi is as good as Sushi Rock or Pacifie East. But the service was pretty bad we have to wait about 10 mins before the server come to take our order.Wait about another hour before we get out sushi by that time my kids was ready to go home.Never get out tea or water refill. Wait anther 10 mins to get out check.
great restaurant! good service and one of the best steak I ever have!!!

Went to # pho for lunch today. It wasn't very good I had the pho the broth doesn't have any taste. My wife order crepes and it is bad also. 
The server are busy texting on their phone never take any dirty dishes from our table!
Fantastic Italian food,salad is very fresh, great veal cook just right, but the services is little slow for me!

If you walk in to this place expecting a Michelin star meal for 3 dollars, you're going to have a bad time. 

The Enchiladas Mexicanas is 8 dollars... For 6 enchiladas. Tell me you didn't use chips to get every last bit of queso off the plate. That's what I thought.

 The chips are warm, the salsa has just the right hint of spice. The enchiladas were masterfully crafted by Mexican wizards hiding somewhere in the back.

In the get absolutely stuffed for 10 bucks and enjoy every minute of it category - This place gets 5 stars.

5/5 would cram more into my maw if I wasn't already going to explode.
Their polish boys are okay if you don't feel like driving to your favorite BBQ place to get it. They did not have an AC so dinning in on a hot day is not a good idea.

Progressive is disgusting, unprofessional and disrespectful. After my " We don't care" attitude, I will let Everyone I can know how HORRIBLE this entire company is. I was trying to get a hold of the agent assigned to my case. She said I don't need to talk to her so we don't argue.
There is no argument you repulsive hood-rat. Learn how to speak properly when you are working with people and REALIZE that calls are recorded, so you cant tell me that everything's going to be a certain way, then you change your tune when its time for business! HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!

Walked in because of the reviews, got in and was greeted immediately! Asked the gentleman what do people order and recommended the Lexington! 3 Egg White, Turkey and substituted pepper jack for provolone!!  Definitely a good choice!

Stopped in for the first time today as I had heard this past week that Brittany, whom we had met when she worked at L'Albatros, had started this patisserie. The website  is very good and the pastries we had were excellent. We ordered a Sugar Lime Cookie, a Napoleon, a Fudge Brownie with Pistachio Topping and a Chocolate Whoopie cookie. Next time we're going to try a S'Mores cookie. The person in line behind us said that Sugar Me is as close to a French patisserie as you're going to find around here. I suppose you could add Coquette Patisserie in University Circle to that list but it's great having Sugar Me so close. They have very good store hours including noon to 4:00 PM on Sunday which means we may be stopping in after church.

Dewey's is the quintessential neighborhood coffee shop. Personal, friendly service, well trained baristas, house made sweets, soups and sandwiches are standard plus house made popcorn and very good ice cream. Often they have live music on the weekends, art you can buy on the walls and outdoor seating in the warmer months. Come alone or bring a friend or the family.

Ate here for the first time and loved it.  The maître'd, Andrew, was extremely helpful and friendly and the waiter, Jay, was knowledgeable and attentive. My wife and I split the calamari which was excellent and she had the bolognese and I had the osso bucco and both were great. The cocktails, wines, desserts (I recommend the gelatos) and coffee were top-notch. A fun place to stop for an evening before the theater or just to enjoy dinner. We highly recommend it.
Stopped in for the first time and grabbed a quick lunch. Had the lunch special of raclette (cheese) soup and tuna salad on rye and they were both very good. Will be back soon to try breakfast.

Just moved into the neighborhood and this was our second pizza in a few days as we unpack boxes. This may have have been the first Donatos pizza in awhile but I must say I was impressed. They have recently moved to a new location in the Van Aken Mall and we ordered the first batch for the moving van guys. It was mostly pepperoni and cheese but very tasty with the thin crust. Tonight we ordered a large with half tomato and onions and the other half Serious Meat. While picking it up I noticed they had seasoning shakers near the soda fountain so I added Roasted Garlic and Smoked Chipotle, nice additions. Both times the pizzas were ready for pickup at the time stated. We will definitely be retuning here with their friendly staff and great offerings.
Come here often after church to do some shopping for the coming week and get a bite to eat for lunch. Wonderful salad and soup bar and freshly made sushi. Heinen's does a great job with their stores.

On the way home from a long day I asked my friend who lives in Cleveland Heights what pizza place he likes and without a pause he said Pizza BOGO.  He said the pizza was terrific and that they delivered. At home I asked my wife if she was up for pizza on a Saturday night when we wanted to stay in and watch movies and she was willing to try something new. I called BOGO and asked if they'd deliver to near Shaker Square. They got my zip code asked me to hold the line while they checked and then told me that my address was in the delivery area. I ordered a large Meat Works and a Bianco, both on traditional crust. He said delivery would be in 45 to 60 minutes and I set a timer to see how long it actually would take. The pizzas arrived in 30 minutes. 

The smell was tantalizing and the taste of each one was over the top. My wife declared that these were to two best pizzas in Cleveland and we weren't going anywhere else in the future. We warmed up some leftovers the next day in a toaster oven and they were just as good. Looking forward to trying their other options soon.

Juma is close by our new residence and it's quite a discovery. A combination of a coffeehouse, upscale women's wear and housewares shops in three conjoined buildings. Coffee is great, food for lunch is very good. I highly recommend it.

Always love coming here for breakfast with my wife we're in the area. Good food, honoring to vets and family-run. This morning I'm trying the Gomer Pyle which is a skillet of home fries, tomatoes, mushrooms with eggs and covered with sausage gravy. Should be fun.

First time here after seeing it advertised over the years. Service was great on a beautiful fall Saturday. I had the Galley Boy with onion rings and a peanut butter shake. My wife had the hamburger with lettuce and tomato. The special shake was pumpkin which may have replaced the pecan. Lots of fun and will be back.

Food was pretty yummy. I ordered the chicken philly sandwich as recommended by our waiter Reginald, because it was served on garlic toast. Good choice. The chicken and onions were cooked perfectly. Fries were delicious too. 

My daughter liked her pizza which was very big for being on the kid's menu. She had to take half home. 

Reginald was very very polite and made sure we got our drink orders.  He found us on our way back from the bathroom. 

The place was very slow for a Sunday afternoon but I bet it gets very busy during the week. Everything was clean.  

We would definitely come back.

I've been a patient of Dr. Zanoudakis for something like 8 or 10 years now. I am more than satisfied with his practice. He and the rest of the staff are professionals who treat me with courtesy and respect. 

I will continue to trust my optical needs to Dr. Z!
column7: Zanoudakis Emmanuel, OD - Doctors of Optometry

column6:
Very tasty food at a reasonable price. The multi-grain toast was especially good. The service was friendly and efficient.

Do yourself a favor and stop in on your way to work some morning. You'll be glad you did.
Without question the best corned beef in Parma. Nearly the equal of Slyman's, and at a smaller price.

My friend and I went to Superior Pho out first day in town due to the Yelp reviews. The pho and banh mi sandwich was good...until we came here tonight at Minh-Anh for dinner. This has the best pho I've ever had from Seattle to San Francisco and Buffalo. The broth is very flavorful and I could have eaten it without adding condiments. We got #22 which is a combination of all meats and meatballs. One of the biggest things I love about Minh-Anh is that they use the wider noodles which you don't see often as many Pho places prefer the thinner noodles. It has one of the best tasting broth without having to add siracha and hosin sauce. The shrimp spring rolls were generously filled with shrimp and lettuce leaves (not iceberg lettuce), the only thing missing was bean sprouts. I had the deluxe crepe which had shrimp, chicken and pork filled with bean sprouts and veggies. It was very, very good with a large portion size and delicious sweet and spicy sauce to pour over or on. My friend got the pork vermecilli bowl which was also very good with the pork cooked to perfection.

Our waitress was great and very accommodating with us wanting to split our pho. Great service, great food. Best place in Cleveland to get Pho for sho!
Funky small friendly coffee bar w/ great service. A sparkling water chaser w/ my cappuccino was an added bonus.
Solid. Huge portions of creative bar food. All beer is excellent and the service is some of the best around. Typically very busy, even on week nights. Beware the smoked wings...HUGE!
I'll be going back for sure! I walked out of that place like I was made out of jelly and spaghetti. Highly recommend
column7: A Serenity NOW Massage Z Spa

column6: Just had a great brunch here.  I had the burger & my wife had the pancakes. Everything was delicious (I tasted hers of course).  The bread & jam they bring beforehand was great too.  Would definitely come back & recommend this restaurant to all.  Great service too!

We have lived here for 20 years, we will never return here for family fun...
We have lived thru all the nasty signs that greet you when you order.  "Extras cost extra", spoons $0.10, knapkins $0.05, "if your child drops their icecream it's not our problem".  

So We ordered a kids sunday for my daughter and it came in a shot glass size cup...really?  The owner is nasty and cheap, plenty of other places to go to!

Highly recommend!!  This is our second visit. Reservations are a must to get a table. We all had the pulled pork dinner and one person had the ribs. Everything was very good. We will definitely go back again.

Great Price and tire service, I found them through an on-line tire store as an installer close to my home.  They gave me better deal than what was on line including free tire repair.  They found a problem with the tires I picked out and brought it to my attention.  I figured, oh boy....here comes the up sell.  No, he actually found me the correct tire and saved me another $35.  I would also like to note that while I was waiting, a women came in with a flat.  They did not have her tire because you can only purchase the tires from walmart, but they put her spare tire on for NO charge.  I will definitely be back!

I was enticed by the pleasant window displays I had seen during my frequent passings by, so I decided I would venture from my usual florist to give the Kent Floral Company a shot. Knowing the risk of straying from previous success, especially for such an occasion, I regret my attempt of fixing something that 'aint' broke. 
I ordered my corsage two weeks in advance, figuring I'd beat the seasonal prom rush. I was reassured that my corsage would be ready for pick-up the day of, yet the lady couldn't give me a solid estimate on the price. I felt fairly confident they would do fine, but I left the shop that day with a head full of mysteries. 
When I picked up my corsage; the white flowers were bruised and browned, and the overall appearance of the corsage was in a sorry state. To top that off, the grand total was $26. I wasn't too upset with the price until I was joking with my lady about it later that night, when she said she had bought my boutonniere for a third of the price. A third of the price, and it looked many times better than the corsage I'd gotten her. 

Where'd she get it? Acme!

tl;dr - My prom date got better flowers from Acme, and for a third of the price.

At least the ribbon was nice!

Just this past weekend I had a 2 day conference at the hotel. Everything about it went amazingly. From the A/V help, to the wifi, to the amazing food on Sunday and the beverage service all day both days. We had nothing but glowing reviews of our venue and their service from all of our attendee's, including those who also booked and stayed at the hotel. I highly recommend anyone looking for a venue for a conference speak with Sage and her team.
column7: Kent State University Hotel & Conference Center

column6: The bagels and coffee are both excellent, and reasonably priced! They give you a good portion, but nothing too gluttonous. Also, the bacon and ham are delicious, and not too greasy. Lots of seating and a decent vibe inside. Great place for a solid breakfast sandwich

Worst McDonalds ever, ordered 4 mcchickins and 4 mcdoubles and a halfcut sweet tea with no ice. I got sweet tea with ice and only 3 mc chickens and 3 mcdoubles. And when we called back they said sorry an hung up

Meh. So I was hoping for so much more. The order was wrong (on both entrees) and the food just wasn't that good. We had what we're supposed to be carne asada tacos with soft corn tortillas...instead, it was a piece of carne asada with flour tortillas...gross...we also had chicken enchilada verde. There was almost no verde to speak of, and what was there was terribly under seasoned. The high point was the salsa. The rest was just not worth my time. Adios, guys...I'm not coming back
Delicious and very fresh ingredients. The Fatoosh and the Kebab platters were fantastic. Everything was perfectly seasoned and delicious. Great place! Put it on your list :)

I was visiting Cleveland and searching for a good food to eat and found this place and what a experience ! .

I tried the vegan hot dog and oh boy !! Was it delicious !.the best dog you will ever have .

The place has no pretense .

Host took 5 minutes to get to the desk, there were about 25 people waiting when we arrived. In 10 minutes we waited out of the quoted 35 not one table was sat while we watched tons of people leave. Unacceptable.

What a disaster our visit was...
 When we walked in the place smelled moldy, but we are are adventuress types so we thought we would forge ahead, since its a cool historic building. Terrible service, even though we were only one of two occupied tables. No specials. Wine that tasted like it had turned. Not special food. At first we decided to chalk it up as a lesson- its not like we don't go out often;  its not like this was our one night out a year or something.. But the more we thought about it, the more we realized none of this was acceptable, especially at those prices .   Will not be going back.

Great bread pudding ever!!!  Became familiar with the restaurant at the taste of Akron, returned to this event looking for Moe's.  Visited the restaurant with my son we had a grilled chicken sandwich, Caesar salad and of course the bread pudding.  Great food and atmosphere :-)

I was in Cleveland with a friend for a baseball game, and we pulled out our handy dandy Yelp app to find the best eats nearby. Zocalo was recommended to me before we arrived in Cleveland, so I already had a hunch that we would be eating here.

The first thing we were concerned about was tequila: how can we can the most possible asap. Zocalo offers pitchers of Margaritas in all different flavors, ranging from 28$ to 60$ depending on the brand of tequila, flavor etc. We went with a frozen pitcher, and our waiter who was super cool let us mix the mango and strawberry flavors together. It was SO good, arguably the best frozen marg I've ever had. 

They give you complimentary chips and salsa, which were really good. The salsa didn't have too much cilantro in it, which I appreciate. The waiter also recommended the queso (not telling us it was another 4$) and it was SO GOOD. It was a white queso, really thick and creamy. I got the steak quesadilla as an entrée and was pleased. 

Again, our waiter rocked. He was really helpful with the menu and made conversation with us about the sporting events we were seeing and about our hometown. Definitely a must-stop if you love tequila like we do!

I could not believe my eyes when I pulled up to the house! It takes me right to the 24 hour marathon of the movie during Christmas and Christmas Eve.

They let you touch everything in the house, but not in the museum. If you love this movie as a Christmas classic I push everyone to go and see this place. It is truly amazing.
 
Our tour guide was very knowledgable, telling us the story of the owner of the home; a life-long fan of the movie who put his all into revamping this house into all its glory. They don't let you take videos, however I did because I couldn't resist. The house is put together exactly how it is in the movies, from wall colors, to gift-wrapped bowling balls, to kitchen appliances and open cupboards where Randy hides to drink his milk.

You almost get the chills being inside, knowing that the house has so much history. The surrounding neighborhood, literally meaning the houses next door are not nice and the neighborhood looks a bit run down. I know there is a lot of crime in the area, so we made a quick pitstop on our way to see Lebron.

I wish I would've been there for the Christmas season, we went in February which looking at pictures seems like a good time as there was no line to get in.

The museum shoppe is FILLED with Christmas goodies, from mugs to your very own bar of soap they use in the movie. We got a free calendar with our admission, and every worker was extremely helpful and just as passionate about the movie as the next.
column7: A Christmas Story House and Museum

column6:
When we stayed in Cleveland, after looking at the Yelp app we realized there are so many restaurants in the downtown Cleveland area. We contemplated hitting up 4th street, however a ton of the restaurants were closed on Sundays and we were in a pinch. We looked up the Hodge's menu and decided to give it a try!

The atmosphere inside is really cool- the reviews are right, the giant red chairs are uber comfy and the corn bread is delicious. For the first time in years, I ordered a burger. It was pretty good! Nothing to write home about, the dill cheese that was served on it was interesting. Their tots are cooked to perfection. 

My only complaint is the happy hour/drink deal. Happy hour is only served at the bar... And since we got a table and no one told us that we kind of missed out. Also- the drinks are VERY expensive. It was 13$ for a traditional margarita in a lowball glass. It was good, don't get me wrong. But I couldn't taste the difference between that an a 6$ one from a Mexican place back home.

Unfortunately the restaurant building itself was the best part about this place. The prices were way too high for the quality of food we were served. My friend got a bowl of jambalaya and the rice was over-cooked and cold while my bowl of shrimp creole was both hot and cold. For $13-$16 a plate I feel like we shouldn't have to return our dishes due to them being cold. On top of that the wait was ridiculously long while being offered no real explanation of why we were waiting. Our group of 4 will definitely not be recommending this place to anyone.

The new management was super courteous and prompt with the food when we were dining in. The food was delicious! Authentic and spicy (because we requested extra spice), and I could eat it by the bucket-ful. The peppercorn chicken and spicy lamb were really good. We will definitely be frequenting this location, and it's no wonder that they're so successful in Cleveland. If you like to try new stuff and if you like good food, definitely try it out.

I bought a bike for my wife at the Medina  branch and had a terrible experience with bad rude employees but it was the bike she wanted so we paid over a thousand dollars and didn't even get so much as a smile or thank you for your business. But hey we got the bike we wanted and and I tried to support a local business instead of buying the same one at REI where they would have given %10 off and I know they donate money to the Cleveland parks. I once again thought I'd support local business and went back to get a 35mm quick release for the seat post and was met with confusion by the employee who then asked the mechanic who was confrontational with the employee asking and then when I told him the exactly specs "it's the 35mm qr for a seatpost and you have the exact same bike there on the floor" he did not acknowledge me talking to him and turned around and kept doing what he was doing. Now they get another person to go find it so now there are 3 people involved and 15 minutes in and still no closer to knowing if they have the clamp in stock. I left at this point because I can order it online and not deal with terrible service and I knowledgeable people who want to be rude to me after I've spent 1k on a bike. Oh and by the way I wanted to get the salsa timberjack slx version close to 2k for myself because I like my wife's but I'll be buying it at REI where their employees are nice people and they respect their customers and know what they're talking about. I'm already dreading the free 90 day tuneup I'll probably take it somewhere else or do it myself because I'm not sure they know what they're doing  and I know they'll be rude to me again.
Love this place. Refined selection of quality products. A bit pricey, but if you're used to buying special natural food store things, you should be able to find it here.

Finally! Delicious pizza in Akron! Fresh homemade toppings on a delicious crust - not too thick, not too thin - with a brick oven crisp. Truly the best pizza we've ever had. Nice outside patio and the renovations inside look great. Fun staff. Cool atmosphere. Great neighborhood walk-up. Must try!
Stopped by tonight at 6:15 snd the restaurant is CLOSED!!! Sign on the door that the owner is consolidating restaurants and that the Lee Rd site was sold July 26th!

Just went here for the first time on a Groupon with a friend and thoroughly enjoyed our meal!  Hot pork, veggie and spinach/tofu chili samplers, cornbread and apple slaw sides (all delicious!), art on the walls, relaxed and unassuming.  Cook manning the counter very friendly and helpful, great place for a unique tasty lunch experience.  Will definitely come back!!

First time trying this restaurant. Food is excellent, entrees Ravioli Di Aragosta (lobster) and Gnocchi al Ragu Bolognese, both very good. Tasty sauces and al dense pasta and gnocchi.
We were there about 7:15 on a Saturday night and the restaurant, which seats about 30, was full with only two servers. Food was not overly delayed, but there was little attention to water refills and request for more bread. I hope they can ramp up their coverage to match the popularity of this new establishment. We'll come back soon and maybe have a chance to try something from the dessert menu!

Great place to get a quick lunch or dinner (and sign says they will soon serve breakfast). My wife and I have been here twice now for dinner and were quite pleased with the food and the clean, friendly atmosphere.
Format is that you order your food at the counter, pay, and get an order number to place on your table centerpiece. You get your own beverages at the service counter. Food is brought out to you when it's ready.
Not quite sure how to tip when the service is somewhat minimal, and adding a tip when you pay before dining doesn't seem quite right.
Food was excellent, if a bit pricey. We had Mac & cheese with pulled pork (wonderful) and a nicely done salmon entree on our first visit, and our second visit this afternoon was for a Thai peanut rice bowl (chicken, roasted red peppers, broccoli, carrots, pineapple, peanut sauce) and Mediterranean rice bowl (chicken, cucumber, hummus, olives, chick peas, tahini). Not a bad choice yet... so far, the Mac&Cheese with pulled pork is my favorite
We'll be back, and look forward to checking out breakfast fare once it's available.

Our party of four had an excellent dinner at Bianca's tonight, and also enjoyed the live music (The PopTarts).  Prices were reasonable, food was great, our server Renèe was attentive.  Good value and enjoyable dining experience.  The restaurant doesn't stand out (just off of Rt 42/Pearl Rd, entrance on Beverly Hills Dr.), but it's worth finding.

Another great dinner at Creekside, following a matinee at Western Reserve Playhouse. We were able to get potato skin appetizer with bacon on the side since my wife opted out of most meat. Entrees were ravioli and carne asada salad. Excellent food, attentive service, and a great view overlooking the fall colors along the creek.

Came back last Sunday evening and had another excellent meal:  fried pot stickers and chicken satay appetizers, and Hot Spicy Crispy Duck and Thai Style Basil for entrees!  Flavorful large portions, well presented and graciously served, complete with plate decorations of butterflies carved from carrots.  Great value for fine dining!

Back to Banana Blossom in a group of four, back for the food and pleasant service and not disappointed.  Arrived about 7:30 on a Friday evening and was pleased that the restaurant had more of a crowd, hoping they'll continue to thrive a bit off the main drag here in the Ohio City area.
Chive pancakes, pot stickers and calamari appetizers shared and enjoyed.  For entrees our group had hot crispy fried duck, pad Thai, papaya salad, and beef pepper satay, delicious!   Service was fine, all food brought out in a timely fashion, very personable server, no problems.
Another fine dinner at BBTC!
Phone number disconnected, closing doesn't appear to be temporary

Had a very nice breakfast here this morning! My wife satisfied her hankering for blueberry pancakes with a large stack and enough left to take home. I had a meat lover's omelet. Everything was well-prepared, waitress was efficient and very personable. Great little neighborhood restaurant for home-cookin' cuisine. Not fancy, but great value!

Went to Roxu on Wednesday night (7/26) with four in our group. Started with the steam buns (vegan, philly, Kung Pao Chicken) and ginger margaritas (tea for me), all quite tasty. Picked our entrees from the Noodle Bowl list: Pad thai, Pho, and Jasmine with Tofu. Have been here three times now and never disappointed with the eclectic fusion food or service. Our server Alyssa was personable, knowledgable, and kept checking back all thru our meal to refill beverages/water and get anything else we needed.

So glad we have this unique restaurant in the Lakewood 'hood!

Ohio Kebab just re-opened in their new location at 3359 W 117th (just south of Lorain Ave.).

My wife and I enjoyed some wonderful appetizers, eggplant, vegetables in red sauce, very tasty hummus and tabouleh, and great pita. For our entrees we had lamb, rice, corn and the delicious red cabbage salad. Got to sample two sauces, a green hot sauce with a nice burn and a nice white garlic sauce. Filled up and extra to take home. We've found our new go-to Middle Eastern/Greek restaurant. Planning on having felafel and dolmades on our next visit.

The restaurant is very nicely laid out with two dining rooms, plenty of tables, and a carpeted area with pillows for those so inclined. Also, wall artworks are tasteful and appropriate to the atmosphere.

Found this place in the Yelp list Thursday night 8:15 pm after the first two LAKEWOOD pizza places I called didn't answer the phone. Very pleasantly surprised at getting a great 14" thin crust pizza with unlimited toppings for $15.99, ready for pickup 20 minutes after I called.
They just opened a couple of weeks ago, located in a small storefront on St Charles just south of Detroit (behind Panera and Beltone outlet). Small menu, three pizza sizes with choice of over a dozen toppings, four kinds of 8" sub sandwiches, and soda. Menu cites Stromboli on the top, but they haven't worked that one out yet given their current baking equipment.
Price is good, tasty pizza, and very convenient pick-up site for hungry Lakewoodites!

We had an excellent meal here tonight, never been here and found it thru Yelp.
Lots of specials listed on the board in the entrance hallway, so check that before you take your table. Aldo's is very small, seating for maybe 25-30 max, and they don't take reservations, so I called before we left to make sure we wouldn't be waiting a long time for a table (arrived 7:15 on a Sunday evening)
Very good service staff, not too noisy, and excellent food prepared without any major delays. My wife had baked halibut on a bed of spinach, and I had truffle pasta with truffle oil, both good sized portions and delicious.
We now have a new authentic Italian restaurant on our short list for dining on the west side!

Seems that I am always held up in the drive thru line because they are continuously low on one of the items I continue to purchase. Funny because the other people must feel the same way because each car has to wait 5-10 minutes every time I come here. Food not consistent in quality, actually kind of better quality when I have to wait because it is more fresh, but as a ex-worker in the restaurant business, I know it isn't hard to have consistently fresh food.

Best Chinese food in town! Harry used to own The Golden Palace, on Mentor Ave., in Mentor. His take-out place has kept the original quality, thank goodness. The egg rolls won an award back in the Cleveland Food Fair, days that used to be held at Berea Fairgrounds. Just awsome. Now, I'm hungry!
